    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">

  </head>
  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

<p>In level 1 you can make a story with a different main character that you enter yourself.</p>
<p>As the first line, use this code:</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>
<p>Using <code>forward</code> you draw a line forwards. The number behind it determines how far the turtle will walk. <code>turn right</code> turns a quarter turn in clockwise direction, <code>turn left</code> turns counter clockwise.</p>
<p>This is the start of a little staircase. Can you make it have 5 steps?</p>

              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>

<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

      <img src="https://hedy-beta.herokuapp.com/images/Hedylightbulb_1.svg" onclick="hedyApp.modalStepOne()" class="cursor-pointer hidden h-28 absolute ltr:ml-96 rtl:mr-96 -mt-6" id="repair_button" style="visibility: hidden;">
      <div class="flex justify-between">
        <button id="runit" class="green-btn" onclick="hedyApp.runit(1, 'en')">Run code </button>
        
      </div>
      <div id="speak_container" class="hidden mt-4" style="display: block;">
        <label for="speak_dropdown">Read aloud </label><select id="speak_dropdown" class="p-2 border-grey border">
          <option value="">🤫</option>
        <option value="Microsoft George - English (United Kingdom)">📣 Microsoft George - English (United Kingdom)</option><option value="Microsoft Hazel - English (United Kingdom)">📣 Microsoft Hazel - English (United Kingdom)</option><option value="Microsoft Susan - English (United Kingdom)">📣 Microsoft Susan - English (United Kingdom)</option><option value="Microsoft David - English (United States)">📣 Microsoft David - English (United States)</option><option value="Microsoft Mark - English (United States)">📣 Microsoft Mark - English (United States)</option><option value="Microsoft Zira - English (United States)">📣 Microsoft Zira - English (United States)</option></select>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div class="order-5">
      <br>
      <div class="flex justify-end">
        
        
            <button class="green-btn ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" onclick="hedyApp.prompt_unsaved (function () {window.location = '/hedy/2'})">Go to level 2</button>
        
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
<!-- developer mode toggle -->
<div class="mx-auto mt-4 w-64 border-gray-400 border-2 rounded-full py-2 px-4" id="developers_toggle_container" style="display: none;">
  <label for="developers_toggle" class="flex flex-row items-center justify-center cursor-pointer">
    <div class="relative">
      <input id="developers_toggle" type="checkbox" onclick="hedyApp.toggle_developers_mode(true)" class="sr-only">
      <div class="w-10 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full shadow-inner"></div>
      <div class="toggle-circle absolute w-6 h-6 bg-white rounded-full shadow ltr:-left-1 rtl:-right-1 -top-1 transition" style="top: -5px;"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="ltr:ml-3 rtl:mr-3">Programmer's mode</div>
  </label>
</div>

    <div class="text-sm mt-10 ltr:mr-5 rtl:ml-5 font-extralight">
    Latest update: Jan 25(94c5f5)
    </div>
</div>


</div>



      <canvas id="confetti" style="width: 60vw;" class="hidden"></canvas>
    </div>
    <div id="achievement_pop-up" class="inset-0 absolute z-10 fixed hidden" style="width: 500px; top: 60%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
        <div class="bg-blue-600 border-2 border-black rounded-lg px-16 pt-0 pb-4 text-center">
            <h3 class="text-white">You've earned an achievement!</h3>
            <img id="achievement_reached_image" src="https://d1xliaqnpftsm2.cloudfront.net/static-94c5f5fec6cf60e4e0ded40a202a98d170ba67a9/images/achievement.png" class="h-32 mx-auto">
            <h4 class="text-white italic" id="achievement_reached_title"></h4>
            <p id="achievement_reached_text"></p>
        </div>
    </div>
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    
    

  
</body></html>

Hedy

A gradual programming language

What is a gradual programming language?

Learning to program can be hard. Not that programming itself is hard! But there are a lot of rules you need to memorize, just like when you started to learn English. Similarly, you will need a lot of practice to learn programming.

You can read these sentences with ease. But do you remember when you were learning to read? You took some time then for each letter! That is true for programming too, it might be hard in the beginning, but it will get easier!

The nice thing about Hedy is that Hedy is gradual. That means that you do not have to learn all rules at once. The first few levels do not have that many rules, so you can get used to programming comfortably. In every level we add new rules, increasing the number of commands that you know. Commands are instructions for a computer.

Why is Hedy gradual?

In this video Felienne, the creator of Hedy, explains why Hedy is gradual.

Who is Hedy for?

Hedy is meant for all kids that want to learn programming! You do need to be able to read English with ease.

Do I need programming experience?

No, that is not needed. However, if you have programmed with Scratch or Python, some commands will look familiar to you.

Is Hedy free?

Yes! Leiden University allows us to share it for free. Hedy is also 'Open source', which means that everyone who can program can help us make Hedy better. You can find the code on GitHub. If you like Hedy and want to contribute, we do accept (and are very grateful for) donations!

Do I need to install anything?

No. Hedy works in the browser, which is the program you are using to look at this page. Probably Chrome or Edge or FireFox. Hedy also works on your phone or tablet.

You've earned an achievement!

<div id="level-header" class="ltr:pl-8 rtl:pr-8 py-2 bg-blue-200 flex items-center">

  </div>
  <div class="w-full flex items-center justify-end ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-4 rtl:ml-4">
    <input id="program_name" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-1/2 h-4/5" value="Level 1">
    <input type="submit" class="green-btn mx-2 cursor-pointer" value="Save code" onclick="hedyApp.saveit(1, 'en', $ ('#program_name').val (), hedyApp.get_trimmed_code());">
    <input type="submit" class="green-btn mx-2 cursor-pointer" value="Save & share code" onclick="hedyApp.share_program(1, 'en', true, -1, true);">
  </div>
</div>
<div class="flex-grow flex items-stretch">

<div id="commands-window-total" class="flex-none right-hand-shadow ">
    <div>
      <button class="green-btn absolute mt-1 ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" id="toggle-button" onclick="toggleCommands();">← Hide</button>
    </div>
    <div style="width: 250px;" id="commands-window">
      <div id="command_window_content">
          <div class="p-3 shadow-md">
            <div></div>
            <h2>Commands</h2>
          </div>
          <div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Print something with <code>print</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("print Hello welcome to Hedy!");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Ask something with <code>ask</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("ask What is your favorite color?");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Repeat something using <code>echo</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("ask What is your favorite color?\necho so your favorite color is ");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Draw a line with <code>forward</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("forward 100");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Turn the drawing turtle with <code>turn</code></p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("forward 25\nturn left\nforward 25\nturn right");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
          </div>
      </div>
    </div>
</div>
<div tabindex="0" class="flex-grow p-4 overflow-y-scroll">
    
          
      <div id="adventures">
        <div class="flex flex-row overflow-x-scroll overflow-y-hidden mb-2 px-2 pt-2 cursor-pointer">

        <div data-tabtarget="level">
          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>
<p>Using <code>forward</code> you draw a line forwards. The number behind it determines how far the turtle will walk. <code>turn right</code> turns a quarter turn in clockwise direction, <code>turn left</code> turns counter clockwise.</p>
<p>This is the start of a little staircase. Can you make it have 5 steps?</p>

              <h2>Fortune Teller</h2>
<p>Have you ever been to a carnival and had your future predicted by a fortune teller? Or have you ever played with a magic eight ball?
Then you probably know that they can't really predict your future, but it's still fun to play!</p>
<p>In the upcoming levels you can learn how to create your own fortune telling machine!
In level 1 you can start off easy by letting Hedy introduce herself as a fortune teller and let her echo the players' answers.
Like this:</p>

<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

       </div>

            </div>
          </div>

          </div>

  </div>
  <div class="w-full flex items-center justify-end ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-4 rtl:ml-4">
    <input id="program_name" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-1/2 h-4/5" value="Level 1" style="display: none;">
    <input type="submit" class="green-btn mx-2 cursor-pointer" value="Save code" onclick="hedyApp.saveit(1, 'en', $ ('#program_name').val (), hedyApp.get_trimmed_code());" style="display: none;">
    <input type="submit" class="green-btn mx-2 cursor-pointer" value="Save & share code" onclick="hedyApp.share_program(1, 'en', true, -1, true);" style="display: none;">
  </div>

<div class="flex-grow flex items-stretch">

<div id="commands-window-total" class="flex-none right-hand-shadow ">
    <div>
      <button class="green-btn absolute mt-1 ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" id="toggle-button" onclick="toggleCommands();">← Hide</button>
    </div>
    <div style="width: 250px;" id="commands-window">
      <div id="command_window_content">
          <div class="p-3 shadow-md">
            <div></div>
            <h2>Commands</h2>
          </div>
          <div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Print something with <code>print</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("print Hello welcome to Hedy!");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Ask something with <code>ask</code>.</p>

              </div>
              <div class="flex">
                <div class="font-extralight text-sm flex-grow" tabindex="0">
                  
                </div>
                <button class="btn block flex-none self-end ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" style="min-width:6em" onclick="hedyApp.tryPaletteCode("ask What is your favorite color?");">Try</button>
              </div>
            </div>
            
            <div class="justify-between my-2 shadow-md p-3 ltr:pl-4 rtl:pr-4">
              <div class="font-extralight text-lg flex-grow mb-1" tabindex="0">
                <p>Repeat something using <code>echo</code>.</p>

<p>This is the start of a little staircase. Can you make it have 5 steps?</p>

<p>In the upcoming levels you can learn how to create your own fortune telling machine!
In level 1 you can start off easy by letting Hedy introduce herself as a fortune teller and let her echo the players' answers.

top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you finish the scary story? Or make up your own haunted house story?</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="next" class="hidden">
              
              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="end" class="">
              
              <div>
              <h2>End</h2>
<p>This is the end of the level! Take the quiz now to test your knowledge.</p>

      <div class="flex justify-between">
        <button id="runit" class="green-btn" onclick="hedyApp.runit(1, 'en')">Run code </button>
        
      </div>
      <div id="speak_container" class="hidden mt-4" style="display: block;">
        <label for="speak_dropdown">Read aloud </label><select id="speak_dropdown" class="p-2 border-grey border">

    <div class="order-5">

            <button class="green-btn ltr:ml-1 rtl:mr-1" onclick="hedyApp.prompt_unsaved (function () {window.location = '/hedy/2'})">Go to level 2</button>
        
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
<!-- developer mode toggle -->
<div class="mx-auto mt-4 w-64 border-gray-400 border-2 rounded-full py-2 px-4" id="developers_toggle_container" style="display: none;">
  <label for="developers_toggle" class="flex flex-row items-center justify-center cursor-pointer">
    <div class="relative">
      <input id="developers_toggle" type="checkbox" onclick="hedyApp.toggle_developers_mode(true)" class="sr-only">
      <div class="w-10 h-4 bg-gray-400 rounded-full shadow-inner"></div>
      <div class="toggle-circle absolute w-6 h-6 bg-white rounded-full shadow ltr:-left-1 rtl:-right-1 -top-1 transition" style="top: -5px;"></div>
    </div>
    <div class="ltr:ml-3 rtl:mr-3">Programmer's mode</div>
  </label>
</div>

    </div>

            <p id="achievement_reached_text"></p>
        </div>

       </div>

            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">

            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>

<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>
<p>Using <code>forward</code> you draw a line forwards. The number behind it determines how far the turtle will walk. <code>turn right</code> turns a quarter turn in clockwise direction, <code>turn left</code> turns counter clockwise.</p>
<p>This is the start of a little staircase. Can you make it have 5 steps?</p>

              <h2>Fortune Teller</h2>
<p>Have you ever been to a carnival and had your future predicted by a fortune teller? Or have you ever played with a magic eight ball?
Then you probably know that they can't really predict your future, but it's still fun to play!</p>
<p>In the upcoming levels you can learn how to create your own fortune telling machine!
In level 1 you can start off easy by letting Hedy introduce herself as a fortune teller and let her echo the players' answers.
Like this:</p>

            <div data-tabtarget="haunted" class="hidden">

              <div>
              <h2>Haunted house game</h2>
<p>In this adventure you are working towards making a game in which you have to escape from a haunted house by picking the correct door.
If you pick the right door you'll survive, but if not a terrible monster might...</p>
<p>In level 1 we start our haunted house game by making up a scary story and ask the player what monster they'll see in the haunted house.</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>

<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you finish the scary story? Or make up your own haunted house story?</p>

            <div data-tabtarget="next" class="hidden">
              
              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-copy-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-buttons" class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-repair" class="hidden">

top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Hedy now only tells you your name. Can you expand the code so that Hedy can predict more things about you?</p>
<p>Obviously, Hedy isn't a very good fortune teller yet, as she can only repeat the answers that were given by the players!
Take a look in level 2 to improve your fortune teller.</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="haunted" class="hidden">
              
                <img class="ltr:float-right rtl:float-left w-48" src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/hauntedhouse.gif">
              
              <div>
              <h2>Haunted house game</h2>
<p>In this adventure you are working towards making a game in which you have to escape from a haunted house by picking the correct door.
If you pick the right door you'll survive, but if not a terrible monster might...</p>
<p>In level 1 we start our haunted house game by making up a scary story and ask the player what monster they'll see in the haunted house.</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>

<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you finish the scary story? Or make up your own haunted house story?</p>

            <div data-tabtarget="next" class="hidden">
              
              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/generated.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/additional.css">
  	<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/quiz-css.css">
    <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/png" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/Hedy-logo.png">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/vendor/gh-fork-ribbon.min.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/fontawesome/css/all.min.css">
  </head>
  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-copy-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-buttons" class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-repair" class="hidden">
          <div class="absolute top-2 right-2">
              <svg class="fill-current h-12 w-12 ml-auto text-white" id="modal-repair-button" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 20 20">
              <title>Close</title>
              <path d="M14.348 14.849a1.2 1.2 0 0 1-1.697 0L10 11.819l-2.651 3.029a1.2 1.2 0 1 1-1.697-1.697l2.758-3.15-2.759-3.152a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697-1.697L10 8.183l2.651-3.031a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697 1.697l-2.758 3.152 2.758 3.15a1.2 1.2 0 0 1 0 1.698z"></path>
          </svg></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
       </div>
    </div>
    <div id="modal-alert" class="z-50 fixed hidden" role="alert" style="top: 10%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
        <div id="modal_alert_container" class="mx-auto text-center bg-green-100 border-green-400 text-green-700 border rounded px-4 py-3">
            <span id="modal_alert_title" class="block sm:inline"></span>
            <span id="modal_alert_text" class="block sm:inline"></span>
            <svg class="fill-current h-6 w-6 text-green-500 block sm:inline" id="modal-alert-button" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 20 20"><title>Close</title><path d="M14.348 14.849a1.2 1.2 0 0 1-1.697 0L10 11.819l-2.651 3.029a1.2 1.2 0 1 1-1.697-1.697l2.758-3.15-2.759-3.152a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697-1.697L10 8.183l2.651-3.031a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697 1.697l-2.758 3.152 2.758 3.15a1.2 1.2 0 0 1 0 1.698z"></path></svg>
        </div>
    </div>
    <div class="lg:container mx-auto bg-gray-100 min-h-screen shadow-md flex flex-col">
      
      <nav class="bg-blue-500 px-4 text-white flex flex-row items-center">
          <div class="py-1 ltr:mr-6 rtl:ml-6">
            <a href="/">
              <img src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/Hedy-logo.png" style="width: 2.5em;">

          </div>

            <a class="menubar-btn hover:bg-blue-600 border-transparent" href="/login">Log in</a>
          
          
            <div class="dropdown inline-block relative ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto py-2 z-40">
                <button class="bg-blue-400 text-white font-semibold py-1 px-2 rounded inline-flex items-center">
                  <span class="ltr:mr-1 rtl:ml-1">English</span>

                </button>

                    <li class="p-2"><input id="search_language" placeholder="Search..." class="border-2 border-black text-black border-blue-600 rounded h-8 px-2 mt-2 w-full"></li>

                      <a class="no-underline" href="#" onclick="hedyApp.change_language ('es');event.preventDefault();"><li class="hover:bg-blue-600 text-white py-2 px-4 block rounded-lg language">Español</li></a>

overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you think of more lines to add to your restaurant code? For example, can you ask the guests what they'd like to drink, tell them the price, or wish them a pleasant meal?</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="fortune" class="hidden">
              
                <img class="ltr:float-right rtl:float-left w-48" src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/fortuneteller.png">
              
              <div>
              <h2>Fortune Teller</h2>
<p>Have you ever been to a carnival and had your future predicted by a fortune teller? Or have you ever played with a magic eight ball?
Then you probably know that they can't really predict your future, but it's still fun to play!</p>
<p>In the upcoming levels you can learn how to create your own fortune telling machine!
In level 1 you can start off easy by letting Hedy introduce herself as a fortune teller and let her echo the players' answers.
Like this:</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; height: 29px;"></textarea><div class="ace_gutter" aria-hidden="true" style="display: none;"><div class="ace_layer ace_gutter-layer ace_folding-enabled" style="height: 1e+06px;"></div></div><div class="ace_scroller" style="line-height: 0px;"><div class="ace_content"><div class="ace_layer ace_print-margin-layer"><div class="ace_print-margin" style="left: 4px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: hidden;"><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Hedy now only tells you your name. Can you expand the code so that Hedy can predict more things about you?</p>
<p>Obviously, Hedy isn't a very good fortune teller yet, as she can only repeat the answers that were given by the players!
Take a look in level 2 to improve your fortune teller.</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="haunted" class="hidden">
              
                <img class="ltr:float-right rtl:float-left w-48" src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/hauntedhouse.gif">
              
              <div>
              <h2>Haunted house game</h2>
<p>In this adventure you are working towards making a game in which you have to escape from a haunted house by picking the correct door.
If you pick the right door you'll survive, but if not a terrible monster might...</p>
<p>In level 1 we start our haunted house game by making up a scary story and ask the player what monster they'll see in the haunted house.</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; height: 29px;"></textarea><div class="ace_gutter" aria-hidden="true" style="display: none;"><div class="ace_layer ace_gutter-layer ace_folding-enabled" style="height: 1e+06px;"></div></div><div class="ace_scroller" style="line-height: 0px;"><div class="ace_content"><div class="ace_layer ace_print-margin-layer"><div class="ace_print-margin" style="left: 4px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: hidden;"><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you finish the scary story? Or make up your own haunted house story?</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="next" class="hidden">
              
              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; height: 29px;"></textarea><div class="ace_gutter" aria-hidden="true" style="display: none;"><div class="ace_layer ace_gutter-layer ace_folding-enabled" style="height: 1e+06px;"></div></div><div class="ace_scroller" style="line-height: 0px;"><div class="ace_content"><div class="ace_layer ace_print-margin-layer"><div class="ace_print-margin" style="left: 4px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; width: 22px;"><div class="ace_scrollbar-inner" style="width: 22px;"> </div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-h" style="display: none; height: 22px;"><div class="ace_scrollbar-inner" style="height: 22px;"> </div></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: hidden;"><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="end" class=""><iframe id="quiz-iframe" class="w-full" title="Quiz" src="/quiz/start/1"></iframe></div>

        <!-- errorbox -->
        <div id="errorbox" class="flex-0 mt-0 bg-red-100 border-t-4 border-red-500 rounded-b text-red-900 px-4 py-3 shadow-md" role="alert" style="display: none;">

      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
<!-- developer mode toggle -->
<div class="mx-auto mt-4 w-64 border-gray-400 border-2 rounded-full py-2 px-4" id="developers_toggle_container" style="display: none;">
  <label for="developers_toggle" class="flex flex-row items-center justify-center cursor-pointer">
    <div class="relative">

    </div>
    <div class="ltr:ml-3 rtl:mr-3">Programmer's mode</div>
  </label>
</div>

    <div class="text-sm mt-10 ltr:mr-5 rtl:ml-5 font-extralight">
    Latest update: DEV
    </div>
</div>


</div>

            <p id="achievement_reached_text"></p>

    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">

  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-copy-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-buttons" class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-repair" class="hidden">
          <div class="absolute top-2 right-2">
              <svg class="fill-current h-12 w-12 ml-auto text-white" id="modal-repair-button" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 20 20">
              <title>Close</title>
              <path d="M14.348 14.849a1.2 1.2 0 0 1-1.697 0L10 11.819l-2.651 3.029a1.2 1.2 0 1 1-1.697-1.697l2.758-3.15-2.759-3.152a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697-1.697L10 8.183l2.651-3.031a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697 1.697l-2.758 3.152 2.758 3.15a1.2 1.2 0 0 1 0 1.698z"></path>
          </svg></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
       </div>
    </div>
    <div id="modal-alert" class="z-50 fixed hidden" role="alert" style="top: 10%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
        <div id="modal_alert_container" class="mx-auto text-center bg-green-100 border-green-400 text-green-700 border rounded px-4 py-3">
            <span id="modal_alert_title" class="block sm:inline"></span>
            <span id="modal_alert_text" class="block sm:inline"></span>
            <svg class="fill-current h-6 w-6 text-green-500 block sm:inline" id="modal-alert-button" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 20 20"><title>Close</title><path d="M14.348 14.849a1.2 1.2 0 0 1-1.697 0L10 11.819l-2.651 3.029a1.2 1.2 0 1 1-1.697-1.697l2.758-3.15-2.759-3.152a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697-1.697L10 8.183l2.651-3.031a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697 1.697l-2.758 3.152 2.758 3.15a1.2 1.2 0 0 1 0 1.698z"></path></svg>
        </div>
    </div>
    <div class="lg:container mx-auto bg-gray-100 min-h-screen shadow-md flex flex-col">
      
      <nav class="bg-blue-500 px-4 text-white flex flex-row items-center">

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>

<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you think of more lines to add to your restaurant code? For example, can you ask the guests what they'd like to drink, tell them the price, or wish them a pleasant meal?</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="fortune" class="hidden">
              
                <img class="ltr:float-right rtl:float-left w-48" src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/fortuneteller.png">
              
              <div>
              <h2>Fortune Teller</h2>
<p>Have you ever been to a carnival and had your future predicted by a fortune teller? Or have you ever played with a magic eight ball?
Then you probably know that they can't really predict your future, but it's still fun to play!</p>
<p>In the upcoming levels you can learn how to create your own fortune telling machine!
In level 1 you can start off easy by letting Hedy introduce herself as a fortune teller and let her echo the players' answers.
Like this:</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; height: 29px;"></textarea><div class="ace_gutter" aria-hidden="true" style="display: none;"><div class="ace_layer ace_gutter-layer ace_folding-enabled" style="height: 1e+06px;"></div></div><div class="ace_scroller" style="line-height: 0px;"><div class="ace_content"><div class="ace_layer ace_print-margin-layer"><div class="ace_print-margin" style="left: 4px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: hidden;"><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Hedy now only tells you your name. Can you expand the code so that Hedy can predict more things about you?</p>
<p>Obviously, Hedy isn't a very good fortune teller yet, as she can only repeat the answers that were given by the players!
Take a look in level 2 to improve your fortune teller.</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="haunted" class="hidden">
              
                <img class="ltr:float-right rtl:float-left w-48" src="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/hauntedhouse.gif">
              
              <div>
              <h2>Haunted house game</h2>
<p>In this adventure you are working towards making a game in which you have to escape from a haunted house by picking the correct door.
If you pick the right door you'll survive, but if not a terrible monster might...</p>
<p>In level 1 we start our haunted house game by making up a scary story and ask the player what monster they'll see in the haunted house.</p>
<h2>Example Hedy code</h2>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<h2>Challenge</h2>
<p>Can you finish the scary story? Or make up your own haunted house story?</p>

              
              </div>
              <div class="ltr:clear-right rtl:clear-left"></div>
            </div>
          
        
          
            <div data-tabtarget="next" class="hidden">
              
              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>
<pre class="text-lg rounded ace_editor ace-monokai ace_dark"><textarea class="ace_text-input" wrap="off" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly="" style="opacity: 0; font-size: 1px; height: 29px;"></textarea><div class="ace_gutter" aria-hidden="true" style="display: none;"><div class="ace_layer ace_gutter-layer ace_folding-enabled" style="height: 1e+06px;"></div></div><div class="ace_scroller" style="line-height: 0px;"><div class="ace_content"><div class="ace_layer ace_print-margin-layer"><div class="ace_print-margin" style="left: 4px; visibility: hidden;"></div></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_text-layer" style="height: 1e+06px; margin: 0px 4px;"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_marker-layer"></div><div class="ace_layer ace_cursor-layer ace_hidden-cursors"><div class="ace_cursor"></div></div></div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-v" style="display: none; width: 22px;"><div class="ace_scrollbar-inner" style="width: 22px;"> </div></div><div class="ace_scrollbar ace_scrollbar-h" style="display: none; height: 22px;"><div class="ace_scrollbar-inner" style="height: 22px;"> </div></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: hidden;"><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;"></div><div style="height: auto; width: auto; top: 0px; left: 0px; visibility: hidden; position: absolute; white-space: pre; font: inherit; overflow: visible;">XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</div></div><div style="position: absolute; top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

</div>

    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/generated.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/additional.css">
  	<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/quiz-css.css">
    <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/png" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/Hedy-logo.png">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/vendor/gh-fork-ribbon.min.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/fontawesome/css/all.min.css">
  </head>
  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-copy-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-buttons" class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-repair" class="hidden">
          <div class="absolute top-2 right-2">
              <svg class="fill-current h-12 w-12 ml-auto text-white" id="modal-repair-button" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 20 20">
              <title>Close</title>
              <path d="M14.348 14.849a1.2 1.2 0 0 1-1.697 0L10 11.819l-2.651 3.029a1.2 1.2 0 1 1-1.697-1.697l2.758-3.15-2.759-3.152a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697-1.697L10 8.183l2.651-3.031a1.2 1.2 0 1 1 1.697 1.697l-2.758 3.152 2.758 3.15a1.2 1.2 0 0 1 0 1.698z"></path>
          </svg></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-repair-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
       </div>
    </div>
    <div id="modal-alert" class="z-50 fixed hidden" role="alert" style="top: 10%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
        <div id="modal_alert_container" class="mx-auto text-center bg-green-100 border-green-400 text-green-700 border rounded px-4 py-3">

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>

              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>

top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/generated.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/additional.css">
  	<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/quiz-css.css">
    <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/png" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/Hedy-logo.png">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/vendor/gh-fork-ribbon.min.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/fontawesome/css/all.min.css">
  </head>
  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>
            </div>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-copy" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-copy-title" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl hidden"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div id="modal-copy-buttons" class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-copy-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Copy link to share</button>
            <button id="modal-copy-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4 hidden">OK</button>

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>

              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>

<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

</div>



      <canvas id="confetti" style="width: 60vw;" class="hidden"></canvas>

            <p id="achievement_reached_text"></p>
        </div>
    </div>

    <title>Level 1 – Hedy</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Zilla+Slab:ital,wght@0,300;0,400;0,500;0,600;0,700;1,300;1,400;1,600;1,700&display=swap">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/generated.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/additional.css">
  	<link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/css/quiz-css.css">
    <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/png" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/images/Hedy-logo.png">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/vendor/gh-fork-ribbon.min.css">
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://127.0.0.1:8080/fontawesome/css/all.min.css">
  </head>
  <body id="main_container" class="bg-gray-400" dir="ltr">
    <noscript>Hedy requires Javascript to be enabled in your browser.</noscript>
    <div id="modal-mask" class="hidden fixed bg-black z-50 w-full h-full opacity-75"></div>
    <div id="modal-content" class="hidden fixed z-50 p-12 px-16 bg-blue-400 border-2 border-gray-400 rounded-lg text-lg text-center" style="top: 40%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%, -50%);">
       <div id="modal-confirm" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-confirm-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
            <button id="modal-yes-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Yes</button>
            <button id="modal-no-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">No</button>
          </div>
       </div>
       <div id="modal-prompt" class="hidden">
          <div id="modal-prompt-text" class="text-white mb-8 text-xl"></div>
          <div class="ltr:ml-auto rtl:mr-auto ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto">
            <input id="modal-prompt-input" type="text" class="border border-green-400 rounded p-2 px-3 w-4/5 mt-1">
            <div class="mt-4 flex flex-row justify-center">
                <button id="modal-ok-button" class="green-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">OK</button>
                <button id="modal-cancel-button" class="red-btn block m-4 w-40 pb-4 pt-4">Cancel</button>

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

              <h2>Let's draw</h2>
<p>In level 1 you can also use Hedy to draw. By combining turns and lines, you can make a square or a stair!</p>
<p>Using <code>forward</code> you draw a line forwards. The number behind it determines how far the turtle will walk. <code>turn right</code> turns a quarter turn in clockwise direction, <code>turn left</code> turns counter clockwise.</p>
<p>This is the start of a little staircase. Can you make it have 5 steps?</p>

              <div>
              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>

top: 5px; right: 5px; width: auto;"><button title="Try" class="green-btn" style="font-family: sans-serif;">⇥</button></div></pre>
<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>

          <p>Welcome to Hedy! In Level 1 you can use the commands <code>print</code>, <code>ask</code> and <code>echo</code>.</p>
<p>In the left bar you can see all commands of level 1.</p>
<p>Press the blue button and the code will be typed for you!</p>
<p>Try the code yourself with the green 'Run code' button under the left programming field.</p>
<p>Don't know what to create? In the next tabs you find some ideas for what to build.</p>

<p>As the first line, use this code:</p>

              <h2>What's next?</h2>
<p>Congratulations! You've reached the end of level 1. Hopefully you've already made some awesome codes, but Hedy has a lot more to discover.</p>
<p>In the first level you might've notice that the <code>echo</code> command can only save one bit of information at a time.
For example in the restaurant adventure, you could echo what the costumer wanted to eat, or what they wanted to drink, but not both in one sentence.</p>

<p>If the player types a hamburger and coke, you can't say <code>so you would like a hamburger and coke</code>, but you have to make two separate line.
Also, the <code>echo</code> command only echoes the word at the end of the sentence. So you can't say <code>your hamburger is coming right up!</code>.</p>
<p>That changes in level 2. In level 2 you'll learn to work with variables, that allow you to save multiple pieces of information and print them in any place you want.
Besides, you'll learn how to work with the <code>at random</code> command, that you can use to make games.
So let's go to the next level!</p>
